lines.text: Say, I heard you were in the Navy.
So did the Japs. And when they did, there was more Hari-Kari and throat cutting than at a Harlem red party.
Maybe them Nazis is suing you for assault and battery.
And, uh... here's an extra $100. You better get a bicycle.
For another $200 I can get a motorcycle.
Oh, that's a good idea, Jackson, a good idea. There's $300, get one with a sidecar in it.
Oh, did you fix his room?
Mm-hm. Everything is just as he left it.
Must be an awful mess.
It's our civic duty to encourage hens to lay as many eggs as possible.

[seeing how fast Monty's losing money]
I wisht I was back in a foxhole.
I'd've been here sooner but I got a new motorcycle and it's breakin' me in.
Try knocking on the door again.
If I knock anymore, the termites are gonna start complaining.
Is he still talking to himself?
No, he's answering himself now.
Can she dance? Have you got as glass of water and a piano?
This guy is anemic.
Oh.
He keeps his dough in a blood bank.
But you've got three hundred and seventy-five grand in "The Girl With The Sweater!"
Must you be so material?
There was no material in THAT sweater.
That Trixie's loaded with dynamite.
And sex. She throws it around like she was sprayin' a garden.
Say, boss, you do about the most expensive strip tease I've ever seen.
